analyzed: ci ltar na gcig po rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho na la yod pa'i phyir de dang 'khrul pa med pa can yin zhing /
translated: How is it that the one that is nonerrone with respect to the predicate is only present when the predicate exists,üîΩand how is it that the one that is nonerrone with respect to the property to be proven is only present when the property to be proven exists?

original: de nyid la yang gzhan de la gnod par byed pa yod pa kho na yang yod pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba srid bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid la yang gzhan de la gnod par byed pa yod pa kho na yang yod pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba srid bar 'gyur /
translated: And if it is the case that it is only that which is harmed by another that exists, then it is possible that it is incompatible with that.

original: gzhan yang gtan tshigs de gal te rang bzhin kho nas chos de yod pa can yin na de'i tshe don gzhan nye bar lhung na yang ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtan tshigs de gal te rang bzhin kho nas chos de yod pa can yin na de'i tshe don gzhan nye bar lhung na yang ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if that reason is only the nature of that existent phenomenon, then even when another object is added, how could it be otherwise?

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is impossible for the nature of things to be both the nature of being otherwise and incompatible with being otherwise.

original: ci ste rang bzhin gyis chos de yod pa can ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste rang bzhin gyis chos de yod pa can ma yin na /
translated: But if that existent phenomenon is not by nature existent,

original: de ltar gyur na gzhan gyi dus na yang 'ga' zhig gi yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gzhan gyi dus na yang 'ga' zhig gi yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, even at another time, it would not be established by anything.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin kho na rang gi bsgrub par bya ba de med na mi 'byung ba can ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs la ni de'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal zla'i gtan tshigs srid pa ma yin no zhes pas brjod pa 'dod pa'i
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin kho na rang gi bsgrub par bya ba de med na mi 'byung ba can ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs la ni de'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal zla'i gtan tshigs srid pa ma yin no zhes pas brjod pa 'dod pa'i
translated: Thus, the assertion that a reason that has the nature of being a nonobservation of a related object is contradictory with a reason that has the nature of being a nonobservation of a contradictory object is not correct.

original: grangs gcig pa can ni mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: grangs gcig pa can ni mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: The one that has the nature of being a nonobservation of a related object is not a characteristic.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba mi brjod par thal lo zhen /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba mi brjod par thal lo zhen /
translated: It follows that you do not state a contradictory nonobservation.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags la mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med de /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags la mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med de /
translated: There is no error because we do not assert that a reason that engages through the power of the thing is contradictory with a reason that engages through the power of the thing.

original: 'di'i yul yang pha rol du shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i yul yang pha rol du shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of that is also understood to be the other.

original: yang shes pa rtags kyi chos ma yin na ci ltar rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: yang shes pa rtags kyi chos ma yin na ci ltar rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin /
translated: If consciousness is not the property of the subject of the reason, how is it the characteristic of the reason?

original: rtags ngo bo ci lta bu las don rtogs par bya zhes sems can /
analyzed: rtags ngo bo ci lta bu las don rtogs par bya zhes sems can /
translated: What is the nature of the reason from which the object is to be understood?

original: rtogs pa po'i mi bslu ba nyid ni tshul du brjod par bya la /
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i mi bslu ba nyid ni tshul du brjod par bya la /
translated: The infallibility of the cognizer is to be stated as the mode.

original: gang mthong ba las 'di sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa dag rab tu rnam par phye nas de'i 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed bar yid ches pa las rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: gang mthong ba las 'di sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa dag rab tu rnam par phye nas de'i 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed bar yid ches pa las rab tu 'jug go //
translated: One engages in the practice of the means of valid cognition by ascertaining the means of valid cognition that is the cause of the arising of knowledge, having distinguished that which is a means of valid cognition from that which is not a means of valid cognition.

original: de la gang rtags 'di'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo de mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la gang rtags 'di'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo de mtshan nyid de /
translated: The nature of the sign itself is its definition.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of something else.

original: rtogs pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba tsam las de'i mtshan nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba tsam las de'i mtshan nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were the definition of the sign merely because it is connected to the arising of the understanding, it would follow that anything could be the definition of anything.

original: de ltar na ni gzhal bar bya ba dang skyes bu la sogs pa rnams kyang @83b de'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni gzhal bar bya ba dang skyes bu la sogs pa rnams kyang @83b de'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the object of comprehension, a person, and so on would also be the definition of the sign,

original: de rnams med na yang rtags can la shes pa skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams med na yang rtags can la shes pa skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if they do not exist, the knowledge of the sign does arise in the person.

original: de'i phyir shes pa yang rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod par bya ba ma yin no zhes pas rtags tshul gsum pa'o zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa yang rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod par bya ba ma yin no zhes pas rtags tshul gsum pa'o zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, knowledge is not asserted to be the definition of the sign. Thus the sign is the trimodal logical reason.

original: 'bras bu sngar bzhin zhes pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu sngar bzhin zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is as before.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mngon sum la 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum la 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis bshad de /
translated: Just as two effects are explained for perception,

original: yul yang dag par rig pa dang rang nyid yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yul yang dag par rig pa dang rang nyid yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: the object is correctly cognized and itself is correctly cognized.

original: de ltar 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir yang ngo //
translated: So it is here.

original: mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras tha mi dad pa'o zhes smras pas rjes su dpag pa yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras tha mi dad pa'o zhes smras pas rjes su dpag pa yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said that the effect of inference is not different from the nature of the cognition, it is explained that inference also has the nature of cognition.

original: de'i phyir dri ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir dri ba /
translated: Therefore, the question is asked:

original: gal te gnyis ka yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩyul dang ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o // yul dang ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIf both are the same,‚Äù and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúThe object and the nature are not the same.‚Äù

original: ngo bo mtshungs min 'di dag gi'o //
analyzed: ngo bo mtshungs min 'di dag gi'o //
translated: This is their nature.

original: zhes pa'o // 'di'i sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di'i sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù has the meaning of restriction.

original: 'di kho na gnyis po mi mtshungs kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di kho na gnyis po mi mtshungs kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This alone is not the same, but the nature of cognition is the same.

original: 'o na rtogs pa ni de dag gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'o na rtogs pa ni de dag gi ngo bo ste /
translated: If so, cognition is their nature.

original: de gal te tha mi dad pa yin na ngo bo gzhan pa ci ste /
analyzed: de gal te tha mi dad pa yin na ngo bo gzhan pa ci ste /
translated: If that is not different, why is there another nature?

original: gang / ngo bo mtshungs min 'di dag gi / zhes brjod pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: gang / ngo bo mtshungs min 'di dag gi / zhes brjod pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThese are not similar in nature‚Äù?

original: gang de'i yul dang 'dra ba tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa de mi mtshungs so zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gang de'i yul dang 'dra ba tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa de mi mtshungs so zhes brjod de /
translated: It is said that the presentation of valid knowledge as similar to its object is not similar.

original: de ltar ni de mngon sum gyi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni de mngon sum gyi gsal ba ste /
translated: In this way, it is clear in direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: but not clear in inference.

original: yul ni zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yul ni zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to ‚ÄúThe object . . . ,‚Äù and so on,

original: yul gyi sgras ni 'dir dmigs pa brjod par 'dod pas te /
analyzed: yul gyi sgras ni 'dir dmigs pa brjod par 'dod pas te /
translated: the term object here is asserted to refer to the object of observation.

original: tshang ma nyid kyi yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshang ma nyid kyi yul ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of valid knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mi bslu ba'i mtshan nyid can tshad ma nyid de dngos po'i yul can kho na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mi bslu ba'i mtshan nyid can tshad ma nyid de dngos po'i yul can kho na'o //
translated: Inference also has the characteristic of being nondeceptive and is valid knowledge that has only an existent object.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad pas tshad ma dag yul tha dad par gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad pas tshad ma dag yul tha dad par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said that because the objects of observation are different, the valid knowledges have different objects.

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How are the objects of observation different?

original: so sor snang ba tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the individual appearances are different.

original: gcig la mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa de dag rigs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa de dag rigs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable for those different aspects that are incompatible in a single thing.

original: tha dad ces pa yang tha mi dad pa bkag pa kho nar blta bar bya'i //
analyzed: tha dad ces pa yang tha mi dad pa bkag pa kho nar blta bar bya'i //
translated: The word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù should be seen as only negating non-difference.

original: yul sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a variety of objects.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul med pa can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul med pa can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceptual thought of inference does not have an object.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul gang du 'dod pa de ni de kho na nyid du na yongs su ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul gang du 'dod pa de ni de kho na nyid du na yongs su ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that which is asserted as the object of inference is not established in reality.

original: de'i rnam pa'i bye brag las kyang zhes pa la /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i bye brag las kyang zhes pa la /
translated: Also, from the particular of its aspect.

original: de'i zhes pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul la snyeg go //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul la snyeg go //
translated: ‚Äú Its‚Äù refers to the object of direct perception and inference.

original: de'i rnam pa ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni rang bzhin te /
translated: ‚Äú Its aspect‚Äù is its nature.

original: @84a * // rnam par bya zhing yongs su gcad par bya'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: @84a * // rnam par bya zhing yongs su gcad par bya'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: Having said that it should be differentiated and completely divided.

original: de'i rnam pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: ‚Äú The particular of its aspect‚Äù

original: tha dad pa'o zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'o zhes pa'i don te /
translated: means ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù

original: bye brag smos pa yang bye brag med pa dgag pa rtogs pa byed pa lhur len par rig par bya'i sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dis /
analyzed: bye brag smos pa yang bye brag med pa dgag pa rtogs pa byed pa lhur len par rig par bya'i sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dis /
translated: The mention of the particular should be understood as intending to negate the absence of difference.

original: rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but not as an object of understanding,

original: phyi ni rnam par brtags pa nyid kyis med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ni rnam par brtags pa nyid kyis med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the external object does not exist, as has been demonstrated.

original: des 'di gsal bar byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'di gsal bar byas par 'gyur te /
translated: This is clarified by the following:

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum la phyi rol gyi yul yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum la phyi rol gyi yul yod de /
translated: because the external object exists for perception,

original: gang las de'i yul gyi snang ba gsal bar 'gyur la rjes su dpag pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las de'i yul gyi snang ba gsal bar 'gyur la rjes su dpag pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: from which there is the manifestation of its object, but not for inference.

original: gang de'i yul gyi rnam pa mi gsal ba de ni rang gi sa bon gyi stobs kho na las skye ste /
analyzed: gang de'i yul gyi rnam pa mi gsal ba de ni rang gi sa bon gyi stobs kho na las skye ste /
translated: That which is not the clear form of its object arises only from the power of its own seed.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi ji skad bshad pa ltar ngo bo tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi ji skad bshad pa ltar ngo bo tha dad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, perception and inference are different in nature, as has been explained.

original: yang na mngon sum gyi gzhal par bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dngos su gsal bar snang ba'i rang gi rnam pa skyed par byed pa ste rang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: yang na mngon sum gyi gzhal par bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dngos su gsal bar snang ba'i rang gi rnam pa skyed par byed pa ste rang gi ngo bos so //
translated: Or else, the object of perception is the particular, which produces its own form that appears clearly and directly, by its own nature.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i ni de kho na brgyud pas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i ni de kho na brgyud pas /
translated: The object of inference is that same particular, but indirectly.

original: mi gsal ba'i yul gyi rnam par skyed par byed pa ste gzhan gyi ngo bos gzhal bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i yul gyi rnam par skyed par byed pa ste gzhan gyi ngo bos gzhal bar bya'o //
translated: It is produced in the aspect of an unclear object and is to be cognized by means of another nature.

original: mngon sum gyi yang gzhan gyi ngo bos so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yang gzhan gyi ngo bos so zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that perception also is by means of another nature.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul tha dad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul tha dad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the objects of perception and inference are different,

original: rang bzhin gyi bye brag las /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bye brag las /
translated: their natures are different

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyis na rang gi ngo bo yang tha dad pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyis na rang gi ngo bo yang tha dad pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: because they have the aspects of clear and unclear objects.

original: ci ste ci'i phyir zhes pa rgyu ci yis rjes su dpag pa kho na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi dbye bas na rnam pa gnyis su 'byed kyi /
analyzed: ci ste ci'i phyir zhes pa rgyu ci yis rjes su dpag pa kho na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi dbye bas na rnam pa gnyis su 'byed kyi /
translated: But why? What is the reason that inference alone is divided into two types by way of its own object and another‚Äôs object,

original: mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes des par 'dzin pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes des par 'dzin pa ston par byed do //
translated: but perception is not? This shows that he is grasping at something.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what he would say:

original: rang gis mngon sum du byas pa'i don gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i ched du tshig gang yin pa de gnyis pa gzhan gyi don gyis mngon sum du ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis mngon sum du byas pa'i don gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i ched du tshig gang yin pa de gnyis pa gzhan gyi don gyis mngon sum du ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces pa'o //
translated: Why not accept that the second, the direct perception for the sake of others, is also direct perception, since it is a word that causes another to understand a meaning that one has directly perceived?

original: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because of what?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi yin pas te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi yin pas te /
translated: The object of inference is a universal.

original: de la yang bdag nyid la rjes su dpag pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na pha rol po'i rgyud la tshig gis byed do zhes pas de rnam pa gnyis nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: de la yang bdag nyid la rjes su dpag pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na pha rol po'i rgyud la tshig gis byed do zhes pas de rnam pa gnyis nyid du rigs so //
translated: And since it is just like the inference that one has oneself, it is reasonable that it is just like that in the continuum of another, produced by words.

original: mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid de de la bdag nyid kyi mngon sum gyi shes pa ci 'dra ba de lta bu sgras rgyud gzhan la skyed par nus pa ma @84b yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid de de la bdag nyid kyi mngon sum gyi shes pa ci 'dra ba de lta bu sgras rgyud gzhan la skyed par nus pa ma @84b yin te /
translated: The object of direct perception is a particular. It is not possible for a word to produce in another continuum a direct perception that is just like the direct perception that one has oneself.

original: de ni bstan bya min pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bstan bya min pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not something that can be indicated.

original: gzhan du na long ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sgra las rnam pa de lta bu kho na'i gsal bar snang ba'i shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na long ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sgra las rnam pa de lta bu kho na'i gsal bar snang ba'i shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even the blind would have a cognition that appears as that very form from sound.

original: ci'i phyir de bstan par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bstan par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not to be taught?

original: gsungs pa / gzung tha dad phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / gzung tha dad phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúBecause the object of perception is different.‚Äù

original: gang phyir mngon sum gyi gzung bar bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang phyir mngon sum gyi gzung bar bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because the object of perception is not common.

original: de nges par bstan par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nges par bstan par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to teach that object of perception,

original: de sngar ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngar ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has not been seen before.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Inference is the opposite of that.

original: de'i phyir de kho na'i gzung bya nges par bstan par bya ba yin gyi mngon sum gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na'i gzung bya nges par bstan par bya ba yin gyi mngon sum gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of perception of reality is to be taught, but not the object of perception of inference.

original: rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du zhes pa 'dis 'di gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du zhes pa 'dis 'di gsal bar byed de /
translated: This is clarified by ‚Äúlike itself.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa ste /
translated: The nature of perception and inference is different.

original: 'di ni thams cad kyi so so rang gis rig bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad kyi so so rang gis rig bar bya ba'o //
translated: This is to be known by each one individually.

original: yul tha dad pa med pa nyid la rang gi yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa dag gi de skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa med pa nyid la rang gi yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa dag gi de skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not that they arise in the absence of a separate object, since they conform to their own objects.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar de dag gi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa de ltar yul tha dad par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar de dag gi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa de ltar yul tha dad par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, just as their own natures are separate, so too their objects should be seen as separate.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul ni nges par bstan par bya ba rjes su dpag pa'i lta bu ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul ni nges par bstan par bya ba rjes su dpag pa'i lta bu ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the object of perception is not like the object of inference, which is to be ascertained.

original: gzhan rnams na re sde pa sbyor nyams pa'i 'jigs pa las 'dir gang phyis brjod par bya ba de sngar brjod pas te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams na re sde pa sbyor nyams pa'i 'jigs pa las 'dir gang phyis brjod par bya ba de sngar brjod pas te /
translated: Others say that in order to avoid the fault of disjointedness, what is to be stated later is stated first here.

original: de'i phyir gzhung 'di 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhung 'di 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this text should be understood in this way.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na rnam pa gnyis su 'byed kyi mngon sum ni ma yin zhes dris pa la rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na rnam pa gnyis su 'byed kyi mngon sum ni ma yin zhes dris pa la rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: Why is only inference divided into two types, but not perception? The reason is stated:

original: gzung tha dad phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung tha dad phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of the difference in the apprehended object, etc.

original: gal te gzung bar bya ba tha dad pas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'byed na de ltar gyur na mngon sum yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzung bar bya ba tha dad pas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'byed na de ltar gyur na mngon sum yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: If inference is divided into two types due to the difference of the apprehended object, then direct perception would also have to be divided into two types.üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya min //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya min //
translated: The intrinsic identity is not the object of indication.

original: zhes pa'o // 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te //
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: 'di 'dra ba 'di mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi gzung bar bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba 'di mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi gzung bar bya bar 'dod de /
translated: This kind of object is asserted to be the object apprehended by both direct perception and inference.

original: gang du gcig ni nges par bstan bya yin la /
analyzed: gang du gcig ni nges par bstan bya yin la /
translated: In some cases, one is the object of indication,

original: gzhan nges par bstan bya ma yin pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan nges par bstan bya ma yin pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: but the other is not the object of indication.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na rnam pa gnyis su 'byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na rnam pa gnyis su 'byed de /
translated: Therefore, only inference is divided into two types.

original: gang gi yul tshig gis pha rol po la rtogs par nus pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi yul tshig gis pha rol po la rtogs par nus pa'o //
translated: The object of the one is able to be understood by others through words.üîΩThe object of the other is not able to be understood by others through words.

original: mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not direct perception.

original: 'o na / don dang ni /
analyzed: 'o na / don dang ni /
translated: Well then,üîΩthis is not similar to the object

original: ngo bo mtshungs min 'di @85a * //
analyzed: ngo bo mtshungs min 'di @85a * //
translated: and the intrinsic identity.

original: dag gi / zhes pa 'dis sngar kho nar tshad ma dag gi yul gyi dbye ba bsgrubs zin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dag gi / zhes pa 'dis sngar kho nar tshad ma dag gi yul gyi dbye ba bsgrubs zin pa ma yin na /
translated: This is not a repetition of the earlier proof of the distinction of the objects of the valid cognitions.

original: de tha dad pa las kyang rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de tha dad pa las kyang rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa ste /
translated: It is different from that, and its nature is also different.

original: des na 'di nye bar bkod pa ci yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di nye bar bkod pa ci yin te /
translated: So what is the point of this?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du gzung bya tha dad pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du gzung bya tha dad pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is like the difference between the nature of direct perception and inference.

original: snga ma ni don gzhan la don 'di brjod pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma ni don gzhan la don 'di brjod pa ste /
translated: The former is a different object, but this one is not.

original: da lta ni don gzhan la'o zhes pa skyon med do //
analyzed: da lta ni don gzhan la'o zhes pa skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault, because the former is a different object, but this one is not.

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pas rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya ma yin pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pas rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya ma yin pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúalso‚Äù and so on prove that the particular is not the object of expression,

original: de sgra de kho nas rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes pa mngon sum gyi gzung bar bya ba'i don de sgra de las rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: de sgra de kho nas rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes pa mngon sum gyi gzung bar bya ba'i don de sgra de las rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te /
translated: then it would be inferred by that word alone. The meaning of ‚Äúthe object that is the object of direct perception is understood from that word‚Äù is that

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not like that.

original: long ba la sogs pas kyang mngon sum kho nas de'i don mthong bar gyur na mi rung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pas kyang mngon sum kho nas de'i don mthong bar gyur na mi rung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not right that even the blind should see the object by direct perception.

original: pha rol po ni blun po las skyon 'di ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: pha rol po ni blun po las skyon 'di ma rtogs pas /
translated: The opponent, not understanding this fault in the fool,

original: rang gis khas blangs pa'i tshad ma yul gcig pa nyid mthong ba rjes su sgrub ces pa bstan bcos su'o //
analyzed: rang gis khas blangs pa'i tshad ma yul gcig pa nyid mthong ba rjes su sgrub ces pa bstan bcos su'o //
translated: proves the existence of the perception of the same object by the valid cognition accepted by himself in the treatise.

original: ming las shes phyir rnam pa gzhan //
analyzed: ming las shes phyir rnam pa gzhan //
translated: The cognition of the object is from the name, because of the different aspects.

original: bstan bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The object to be indicated, etc.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa las gzhan spyi'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa las gzhan spyi'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The different aspects are different from the aspects of the particular inherent characteristic.

original: des bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: des bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: It is indicated by that.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not indicated by the particular inherent characteristic.

original: de'i ming ni sngon po'o zhes pa'i 'du shes 'di yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i ming ni sngon po'o zhes pa'i 'du shes 'di yin zhing /
translated: The name of that is the idea of ‚Äúblue.‚Äù

original: de yang rnam par shes par byed kyi /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes par byed kyi /
translated: And that is cognized.

original: don rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the object is not the particular inherent characteristic.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos su yid ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos su yid ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise, the mind is asserted to be of two kinds.

original: sngon po ma yin pa las log pas zhes pa rnam pa gzhan de ston te /
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa las log pas zhes pa rnam pa gzhan de ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin virtue of being the opposite of not being blue‚Äù indicates another aspect.

original: tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyi mngon par bsam pa'i ngo las sngon po ma yin pa las log pas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyi mngon par bsam pa'i ngo las sngon po ma yin pa las log pas zhes brjod do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin virtue of being the opposite of not being blue‚Äù is used in accordance with the explicit intention of those who employ conventions.

original: de rnams ni de kho na nyid du lhag par zhen pas tha snyad du byed do zhes pa 'di brjod de /
analyzed: de rnams ni de kho na nyid du lhag par zhen pas tha snyad du byed do zhes pa 'di brjod de /
translated: This is because they employ conventions due to their adherence to reality.

original: gzhan du na phan tshun rnam par 'joms pa can du 'di 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na phan tshun rnam par 'joms pa can du 'di 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would mutually destroy each other.

original: de ltar ni gal te rnam pa gzhan gyis yid nye bar ston na /
analyzed: de ltar ni gal te rnam pa gzhan gyis yid nye bar ston na /
translated: This is because if the mind were to be revealed by another aspect,

original: de'i tshe des mig gi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba kho na nges par bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe des mig gi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba kho na nges par bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
translated: then it would not be the case that only the experience of visual consciousness is being indicated.

original: ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid de kho na nges par ston na /
analyzed: ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid de kho na nges par ston na /
translated: But if the specific characteristic were being indicated,

original: ming ni rnam pa gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni rnam pa gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: then it would not be by another aspect, such as by the name.

original: spyi ma yin la'ang zhes pa'i yang gi sgra las spyi las yang ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: spyi ma yin la'ang zhes pa'i yang gi sgra las spyi las yang ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúin virtue of not being a universal‚Äù indicates that it is also not a universal, such as impermanence.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa /
translated: The nature of wind, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras @85b nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams mngon sum ma yin pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras @85b nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams mngon sum ma yin pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the non-perceptible things such as space.

original: ji skad du smras pa zhes pa gzegs zan gyis so //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa zhes pa gzegs zan gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAs it is said‚Äù means as it is said by Ka·πáƒÅda.

original: mdo 'di'i 'brel ba ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di'i 'brel ba ni /
translated: The connection of this s≈´tra is as follows.

original: sa dang chu dang me bzhin du 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir na reg pa tsam rlung ngo zhes pa rol pos brjod pa na /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me bzhin du 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir na reg pa tsam rlung ngo zhes pa rol pos brjod pa na /
translated: When the opponent says, ‚ÄúWind is mere contact, because it is not apprehended like earth, water, and fire,‚Äù

original: de yongs su spang ba'i ched du smras pa /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i ched du smras pa /
translated: in order to completely abandon that, it is said:

original: ma mthong ba yang rtags las yang dag par rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yang rtags las yang dag par rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEven what is not seen is understood through a reason.‚Äù

original: yang de'i rtags ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang de'i rtags ci zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: de ltar brjod par bya ste reg bya yang mthong ba rnams kyi yang reg bya ma yin no zhes de ma mthong ba'i rtags can rlung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar brjod par bya ste reg bya yang mthong ba rnams kyi yang reg bya ma yin no zhes de ma mthong ba'i rtags can rlung ngo //
translated: It should be said like this: ‚ÄúWind is the one that has the reason of not being seen, because even what is seen is not a tangible object.‚Äù

original: reg bya yang grang ba dang dro ba'i khyad par dang bral ba yang dag par nye bar dmigs so //
analyzed: reg bya yang grang ba dang dro ba'i khyad par dang bral ba yang dag par nye bar dmigs so //
translated: A tangible object is also correctly observed to be devoid of the distinction of cold and warm.

original: yang gi sgra las sgar dang 'dzin dang g-yo ba rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgra las sgar dang 'dzin dang g-yo ba rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also the cause of the motion of the wind.

original: shing med pa'i yul rnams su ka shu k'a'i sgra nye bar dmigs shing rtsva la sogs pa rnams kyi bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shing med pa'i yul rnams su ka shu k'a'i sgra nye bar dmigs shing rtsva la sogs pa rnams kyi bstan pa ste /
translated: In places where there are no trees, the sound ‚Äúka≈õa‚Äù is perceived and it is the cause of the teaching of grass, etc.

original: de rnams ni rdzas gzhan gyi gegs med na /
analyzed: de rnams ni rdzas gzhan gyi gegs med na /
translated: If there is no obstruction by another substance,

original: lci ba nyid kyi phyir lhung bar 'gyur zing /
analyzed: lci ba nyid kyi phyir lhung bar 'gyur zing /
translated: they fall because of their heaviness.

original: nam mkha' la gnas pa yang mtshon te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas pa yang mtshon te /
translated: They are also indicated as being in the sky.

original: 'khor shing la sogs pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor shing la sogs pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The motion of the wind is the cause of the motion of the wheel, etc.

original: 'di ni mthong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not the cause of seeing, etc.,

original: yang gi sgra las ma mthong ba nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra las ma mthong ba nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin no //
translated: and the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is not the cause of the unseen sky, etc.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnams la ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnams la ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the cause of the unseen because it is the cause of both the seen and the unseen.

original: reg bya'i khyad par ni ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: reg bya'i khyad par ni ma mthong ba ste /
translated: The unseen is a special kind of tangible object.

original: de 'di'i rtags so zhes pas ma mthong ba'i rtag can rlung ngo //
analyzed: de 'di'i rtags so zhes pas ma mthong ba'i rtag can rlung ngo //
translated: It is the cause of that, and therefore it is the wind that has the unseen as its cause.

original: 'di ni sngar mthong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar mthong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not something that was seen before,üîΩbecause it is apprehended first by a particular tangible object.

original: de thog mar reg bya'i khyad par gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa spyi'i spyod yul can ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thog mar reg bya'i khyad par gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa spyi'i spyod yul can ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is an inference that does not have a universal as its domain.

original: ma yin te spyi gsal byed phyir zhes pa la /
analyzed: ma yin te spyi gsal byed phyir zhes pa la /
translated: No, because it clarifies the universal.

original: de zhes pa'i sgras reg bya kho na dang 'brel te /
analyzed: de zhes pa'i sgras reg bya kho na dang 'brel te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected only with tangible object,

original: rlung ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung ni ma yin no //
translated: not with wind.

original: de kho na'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to clarify that, he says,

original: de ni rlung la sogs pa rnams la ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rlung la sogs pa rnams la ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is not for wind, etc.‚Äù

original: reg bya'i spyi brten pa nyid ni yon tan nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: reg bya'i spyi brten pa nyid ni yon tan nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba ste /
translated: The universal of tangible object is supported, and it is clarified by the quality.

original: gang yon tan yin pa de brten pa ste /
analyzed: gang yon tan yin pa de brten pa ste /
translated: Whatever is a quality is supported,

original: dri bzhin / reg bya yang yon tan no //
analyzed: dri bzhin / reg bya yang yon tan no //
translated: like smell. Tangible object is a quality.

original: reg pa nyid ston cing kho bo 'di na zhes 'o na yang zhes pa la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: reg pa nyid ston cing kho bo 'di na zhes 'o na yang zhes pa la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: In order to show that it is tangible, he clarifies it with ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is not this,‚Äù etc.

original: reg pa ni mngon sum gyi don te /
analyzed: reg pa ni mngon sum gyi don te /
translated: Tangible object is the object of touch.

original: de kho na yang gzugs kyis rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes sems so //üîΩres 'ga' zhes pa gang gi tshe reg bya dbang pos reg par @86a * //
analyzed: de kho na yang gzugs kyis rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes sems so // res 'ga' zhes pa gang gi tshe reg bya dbang pos reg par @86a * //
translated: One infers the real thing from the form.üîΩ‚ÄúSometimes‚Äù means when the tangible is not touched by the sense faculty, then.

original: bya ba ma yin pa de'i tshe zhes pa'i don to //üîΩji ltar mngon sum bzhin ma yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa de'i tshe zhes pa'i don to // ji ltar mngon sum bzhin ma yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mngon sum ni khyad par gzhan du zhen pas dben par gnas pa'i ngo bo kho nas reg pa yongs su gcod par byed la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni khyad par gzhan du zhen pas dben par gnas pa'i ngo bo kho nas reg pa yongs su gcod par byed la /
translated: ‚ÄúNot like perception‚Äù means that perception, by the mere nature of being free from attachment to other distinctions, determines the touch.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni dran pas drangs pa'i snga ma rjes su mtshams sbyor ba las te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni dran pas drangs pa'i snga ma rjes su mtshams sbyor ba las te /
translated: But inference is from the connection of the previous memory.

original: de 'di dag gis sngar kho bo 'di dang lhan cig sngar nye bar dmigs so zhes reg pa'i spyi reg pa ma yin pa las log pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di dag gis sngar kho bo 'di dang lhan cig sngar nye bar dmigs so zhes reg pa'i spyi reg pa ma yin pa las log pa'o //
translated: By these, the general touch is determined as the opposite of non-touch, thinking ‚ÄúPreviously, I perceived this together with that.‚Äù

original: dper na zhes pa sngar mthong ba rjes su mtshams sbyor ba la dpe gsungs ba ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes pa sngar mthong ba rjes su mtshams sbyor ba la dpe gsungs ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example‚Äù states an example of the connection of what was previously seen.

original: ji ltar gzugs ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba kho na'o zhes pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas rtags su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba kho na'o zhes pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas rtags su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Just as form is apprehended only by direct perception, it is not inferred by the aspect of its own characteristics.

original: khyad par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: khyad par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because it does not follow a specific object.

original: 'on kyang spyi'i rnam pa kho nas sngar mthong ba rjes su bsdus pas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi'i rnam pa kho nas sngar mthong ba rjes su bsdus pas te /
translated: However, since it is subsumed by what was previously seen by the aspect of a universal,

original: de ltar reg bya yang sngar mngon sum gyis bzung ngo zhes pa kho nas rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar reg bya yang sngar mngon sum gyis bzung ngo zhes pa kho nas rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not that the tactile object is inferred by the aspect of its own characteristics by the mere statement, ‚ÄúThe tactile object was previously apprehended by direct perception.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang rjes su spyi'i rnam pa kho nas rjes su dpag par rung bas so zhes ston te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su spyi'i rnam pa kho nas rjes su dpag par rung bas so zhes ston te /
translated: However, it is shown that it is suitable to infer it by the aspect of a universal that follows it.

original: ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad yin zhe na zhes pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad yin zhe na zhes pa /
translated: How is it that conventions such as ‚Äúseeing‚Äù and so on exist?

original: gal te ji ltar nyams su myong ba ltar smra ba de lta bu'i tha snyad rnams ni 'phags pa rnams sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar nyams su myong ba ltar smra ba de lta bu'i tha snyad rnams ni 'phags pa rnams sbyor bar byed la /
translated: If one speaks in accordance with experience, such conventions are applied by ƒÅryas.

original: khyod kyi lugs kyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar dmigs nas gzhan kho na rjod par byed pa rnams kyi tha snyad rnams 'phags ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar dmigs nas gzhan kho na rjod par byed pa rnams kyi tha snyad rnams 'phags ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In your system, when one observes intrinsic identity, the conventions of those who express only otherness would not be noble.

original: de las kyang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de las kyang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'o zhe na /
translated: And in that case, there would be the fault of contradicting what you accept.

original: mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'di 'chad bar byed de /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'di 'chad bar byed de /
translated: He explains this with ‚Äúseeing,‚Äù etc.

original: mthong bar byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgra de rnams kyang rang gi rgyu mtshan yod pa na 'phags pa rnams kyis sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: mthong bar byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgra de rnams kyang rang gi rgyu mtshan yod pa na 'phags pa rnams kyis sbyor bar byed la /
translated: The words ‚Äúseeing,‚Äù etc., which are the reasons for the activity of seeing, etc., are used by the noble ones when their reasons exist,

original: med pa nam yin no zhes 'phags pa'i tha snyad rnams khas blangs shing /
analyzed: med pa nam yin no zhes 'phags pa'i tha snyad rnams khas blangs shing /
translated: and never when they do not exist. Thus, the noble ones accept conventions,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa las ni ma yin no zhes pas khas blangs pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa las ni ma yin no zhes pas khas blangs pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes ba'o //
translated: but not from the expression of intrinsic identity. Thus, there is no fault of contradicting what you accept.

original: 'o na gang zhes pa la sogs pa bstan bcos dang 'gal ba smras so //
analyzed: 'o na gang zhes pa la sogs pa bstan bcos dang 'gal ba smras so //
translated: ‚Äú Well then,‚Äù etc., states the contradiction with the treatise.

original: 'o na mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba kho na'i skad cig yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba kho na'i skad cig yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: But the moment experienced by visual consciousness is not experienced by mental consciousness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: skad cig gzhan no zhes sngar bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig gzhan no zhes sngar bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it explained above as another moment?

original: de 'di lta bur bshad pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de 'di lta bur bshad pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it explained in this way?

original: 'di ni skyon ma yin te mig gi rnam par shes pas @86b nyams su myong ba kho na'i don zhes rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon ma yin te mig gi rnam par shes pas @86b nyams su myong ba kho na'i don zhes rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is not a fault. The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe object experienced by visual consciousness alone‚Äù is that it is the object that is the dominant condition of the eye sense faculty.

original: rang gi mchan nyid kho na'o zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: rang gi mchan nyid kho na'o zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúits own characteristic alone‚Äù is that it is the object of the eye sense faculty alone.

original: yang na snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig dag rigs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad par brjod par 'dod pas 'di ltar brjod par 'gyur ro //üîΩyang na aa nu ri sgra 'di ni lhan cig pa'i don la 'jug la /
analyzed: yang na snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig dag rigs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad par brjod par 'dod pas 'di ltar brjod par 'gyur ro // yang na aa nu ri sgra 'di ni lhan cig pa'i don la 'jug la /
translated: Or, because the former and latter moments are similar in type, he wishes to state that they are not different and thus he says this.

original: bhu ta'i sgra yang skyes pa la ste /
analyzed: bhu ta'i sgra yang skyes pa la ste /
translated: Or the term anubh≈´ta is used in the sense of ‚Äútogether with‚Äù and the term bh≈´ta in the sense of ‚Äúarisen.‚Äù

original: de las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa kho na'i don rnam par shes par byed do zhes pa 'di 'dir don yin no zhes pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa kho na'i don rnam par shes par byed do zhes pa 'di 'dir don yin no zhes pas skyon med do //
translated: But the meaning here is that it is the object that is known by the eye consciousness that is co-arisen with it.

original: gal te gang de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid de bstan du yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid de bstan du yod pa yin na /
translated: If the intrinsic identity that is experienced by mental consciousness in that way were demonstrable,

original: yid kyis sngon po yang rnam par shes so //
analyzed: yid kyis sngon po yang rnam par shes so //
translated: then mental consciousness would also cognize blue.

original: sngon po zhes kyang zhen cing brjod pa de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po zhes kyang zhen cing brjod pa de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: And it would also apprehend and express blue. How is that?

original: der yang rang bzhin no //
analyzed: der yang rang bzhin no //
translated: In that case, it is the intrinsic nature.

original: yang na de zhes pa'i sgras rlung kho na dang sprel bar bya'o zhes ston pa gsungs pa yang na rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams la ma yin no zhes pa la sogs te /
analyzed: yang na de zhes pa'i sgras rlung kho na dang sprel bar bya'o zhes ston pa gsungs pa yang na rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams la ma yin no zhes pa la sogs te /
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù should be connected only with ‚Äúwind,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di'i don ni gang yon tan yin pa de rdzas la bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gang yon tan yin pa de rdzas la bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that any quality is demonstrable in substance.

original: dri bzhin reg bya yang yon tan yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dri bzhin reg bya yang yon tan yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: Touch is also a quality, like smell. This is the intrinsic nature.

original: reg bya yon tan nyid kyi phyir rdzas la brten pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa na /
analyzed: reg bya yon tan nyid kyi phyir rdzas la brten pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa na /
translated: When it is inferred that the quality of tangibility is based on substance,

original: rdzas nyid tsam ni don gyis 'grub ste /
analyzed: rdzas nyid tsam ni don gyis 'grub ste /
translated: mere substance is established by implication.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyi don nyid du grub pa na gzhan yang don gyis 'grub pa bzhin no zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan gyi don nyid du grub pa na gzhan yang don gyis 'grub pa bzhin no zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: For example, when the eyes, etc. are established as being for the sake of another, the other is also established by implication. This is the intended meaning.

original: yongs kyi lhag ma las zhes pa /
analyzed: yongs kyi lhag ma las zhes pa /
translated: The remainder is from the remainder.

original: yongs su lhag ma las grub ba ni rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yongs su lhag ma las grub ba ni rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
translated: That which is established from the remainder is only inference,

original: rtags las skyes ba nyid kyi phyir zhes sems so //
analyzed: rtags las skyes ba nyid kyi phyir zhes sems so //
translated: because it is born from a reason.

original: ji skad du smras pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: As it is said, etc.

original: reg bya 'di ni sa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: reg bya 'di ni sa'i ma yin te /
translated: This tangibility is not of earth,

original: dri la sogs pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur together with smell, etc.

original: chu dang me dag gi yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chu dang me dag gi yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not of water and fire,

original: dro ba med pa dang grang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dro ba med pa dang grang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is neither hot nor cold.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ma mthong ba rnams kyi yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ma mthong ba rnams kyi yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not of space, etc., which are not seen,üîΩbecause it is not all-pervading.

original: de rnams ni reg bya dang ldan pa nyid na bum pa la sogs ba der so sor thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni reg bya dang ldan pa nyid na bum pa la sogs ba der so sor thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were endowed with resistance, then the pot, etc. would be obstructed in each place.

original: yid kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yon tan nyid kyi phyir 'di'i rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yon tan dag rdul nyid dang gcig nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yon tan nyid kyi phyir 'di'i rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yon tan dag rdul nyid dang gcig nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The qualities of the mind are inferred, and therefore the qualities of the mind are not the same as the atoms, nor are they one with them.

original: 'di ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: This is direct perception.

original: rten med pa'i yon tan yang dag par brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten med pa'i yon tan yang dag par brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: The qualities are not said to be without a basis.

original: de las yongs su ba'i lhag ma @87a * //
analyzed: de las yongs su ba'i lhag ma @87a * //
translated: The remainder is from the remainder.

original: las / reg bya 'di ni rlung kho na'i'o zhes pa 'di ni yongs su lhag ma las grub pa'o //
analyzed: las / reg bya 'di ni rlung kho na'i'o zhes pa 'di ni yongs su lhag ma las grub pa'o //
translated: This resistance is only of the wind. This is established from the remainder.

original: de yod par ma grub pa'i phyir zhes pa /
analyzed: de yod par ma grub pa'i phyir zhes pa /
translated: Because it is not established that it exists.

original: de'i sgras rlung dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: de'i sgras rlung dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: By that word, it is connected with the wind.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan rnams la gang gi mi srid cing de yod pa nyid du grub pa can la de'i yod pa nyid yang dag par 'byung bar bya na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan rnams la gang gi mi srid cing de yod pa nyid du grub pa can la de'i yod pa nyid yang dag par 'byung bar bya na /
translated: Because for others, it is impossible, and when the existence of that is established, then the existence of that arises correctly.

original: gang gi yod pa nyid ma grub na /
analyzed: gang gi yod pa nyid ma grub na /
translated: But when the existence of that is not established,

original: de la yongs su ba'i lhag ma las de yod do zhes yang dag par 'byung ba ci ltar te /
analyzed: de la yongs su ba'i lhag ma las de yod do zhes yang dag par 'byung ba ci ltar te /
translated: In response to that, how could it be correct to say, ‚ÄúIt exists due to the remainder of the barren woman‚Äôs child‚Äù?

original: gang gi tshe der nye ba'i skyes bu gzhan gyis bya ba 'dis byas pa ma yin no zhes yang dag par 'byung ba na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe der nye ba'i skyes bu gzhan gyis bya ba 'dis byas pa ma yin no zhes yang dag par 'byung ba na /
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúThis was not done by another person who is nearby,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bus yongs su ba'i lhag ma las 'di byas so zhes yang dag par 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bus yongs su ba'i lhag ma las 'di byas so zhes yang dag par 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: at that time it is not correct to say, ‚ÄúThis was done by the remainder of the barren woman‚Äôs child.‚Äù

original: de rnams kho na la ni /
analyzed: de rnams kho na la ni /
translated: In those cases,

original: 'di sus byas zhes the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di sus byas zhes the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: it is reasonable to wonder, ‚ÄúWho did this?‚Äù

original: dgag pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir yang zhes pa /
analyzed: dgag pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir yang zhes pa /
translated: Because the negation is the same,

original: de yod pa nyid du grub na yang dgag pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid du grub na yang dgag pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: if the existence of that is established, because the negation is the same, the inference is unreasonable.

original: ji ltar reg bya 'di sa la sogs ba rnams la mchog tu mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa sa de rnams la 'gyur ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: ji ltar reg bya 'di sa la sogs ba rnams la mchog tu mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa sa de rnams la 'gyur ba ma yin pa /
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúThis tactile object is not seen to be supreme in earth and so on,‚Äù it is not so in those.

original: de ltar rlung la yang sngar mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas de la yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rlung la yang sngar mthong ba ma yin no zhes pas de la yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is not so.

original: de lta na yang rlung yongs su ba'i lhag ma las grub pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rlung yongs su ba'i lhag ma las grub pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Even so, how is it established from the remainder of the wind that is completely destroyed?

original: gsungs pa / grub pa na ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / grub pa na ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúWhen established,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar skye ba dang ldan pa bum pa la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid du grub pa de ltar gal te rlung la sogs pa shes 'dod dang ldan pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ba de ltar na ni gtan tshigs grub pa nyid
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba dang ldan pa bum pa la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid du grub pa de ltar gal te rlung la sogs pa shes 'dod dang ldan pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ba de ltar na ni gtan tshigs grub pa nyid
translated: Just as pots and so on that possess arising are established as existent, in the same way, if wind and so on that possess desire to be known were established as existent, then the reason would be established.

original: thob kyi / rnam pa gzhan du na ma yin no //
analyzed: thob kyi / rnam pa gzhan du na ma yin no //
translated: But it is not in any other way.

original: dgag pa mi srid pa na yang zhes pa /
analyzed: dgag pa mi srid pa na yang zhes pa /
translated: Even when negation is impossible,

original: de rnams yod par grub na yang gal te chos de tshad mas gnod pas me la grang ba nyid lta bu yin na /
analyzed: de rnams yod par grub na yang gal te chos de tshad mas gnod pas me la grang ba nyid lta bu yin na /
translated: if those are established as existent, but that phenomenon is harmed by valid knowledge, like the coldness of fire,

original: de lta na yang ma grub pa kho na'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na yang ma grub pa kho na'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur la /
translated: then it is only a reason that is not established.

original: bzlog pa las ni grub ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa las ni grub ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is established.

original: de ltar ji ltar gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du 'gyur bde ltar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du 'gyur bde ltar bstan to //
translated: Thus, it has been shown how the reason is established.

original: yon tan gyi bye brag dang 'brel pa las zhes pa yon tan gyi bye brag ni chos kyi khyad par gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi bye brag dang 'brel pa las zhes pa yon tan gyi bye brag ni chos kyi khyad par gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: From the connection with a particular quality means that a particular quality, which is a specific property, is accepted as the reason itself.

original: de'i 'grel pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'grel pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Its commentary is the probandum and the invariable concomitance.

original: yon tan gyi spyi bor nas zhes pa chos kyi spyi 'khrul pa spangs nas so //
analyzed: yon tan gyi spyi bor nas zhes pa chos kyi spyi 'khrul pa spangs nas so //
translated: From the top of the quality means that, having abandoned delusion about the general property, [the reason] is established.

original: yon tan gyi bye brag gis zhes @87b pa ji skad bshad pa bsgrub bya'i chos can la grub pa'i yod pa nyid can rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyis so //
analyzed: yon tan gyi bye brag gis zhes @87b pa ji skad bshad pa bsgrub bya'i chos can la grub pa'i yod pa nyid can rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyis so //
translated: By a particular quality means by a property that has the existence established in the subject of the probandum, which is endowed with forward and reverse pervasion.

original: rdzas kyi bye brag rjes su dpog par byed la zhes pa yongs su ba'i lhag ma las rlung rjes su dpog par byed ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdzas kyi bye brag rjes su dpog par byed la zhes pa yongs su ba'i lhag ma las rlung rjes su dpog par byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: It infers a particular substance means that it infers the wind from the remaining parts of the whole.

original: der yang spyi'i rnam pas zhes rig par bya'i /
analyzed: der yang spyi'i rnam pas zhes rig par bya'i /
translated: There also, it should be understood by the mode of the general [reason].

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: But not by its own nature.

original: gang gi phyir sngar kho nar rjes su dpag pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid bkag pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar kho nar rjes su dpag pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid bkag pas so //
translated: Because previously we have already refuted inference that has as its object the intrinsic identity of things.

original: bye brag smos pa ni sa la sogs pa'i rdzas bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: bye brag smos pa ni sa la sogs pa'i rdzas bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The specification ‚Äúearth‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the substances of water and so on.

original: de la 'di ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: The argument here is as follows.

original: gang zhig gang las grub pa'i yod pa nyid las gzhan rnams la mi srid ba'i dngos po'i chos yin zhing de la yang tshad mas mi gnod pa de de yir 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las grub pa'i yod pa nyid las gzhan rnams la mi srid ba'i dngos po'i chos yin zhing de la yang tshad mas mi gnod pa de de yir 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever is a property of things that is impossible for those that are not established as existing by that means of establishment and is not contradicted by valid cognition is that of which it is predicated,üîΩfor example, impermanence, which is a property of things that is impossible for those that are not established as existing by the means of establishment of production and is not contradicted by valid cognition.

original: dper na skye ba dang ldan pa rnams las grub pa'i yod pa nyid rnams las gzhan rnams la mi srid pa mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos yin zhing de la tshad mas mi gnod pa de de rnams kyir 'gyur ba bzhin dro ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: dper na skye ba dang ldan pa rnams las grub pa'i yod pa nyid rnams las gzhan rnams la mi srid pa mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos yin zhing de la tshad mas mi gnod pa de de rnams kyir 'gyur ba bzhin dro ba yang ma yin /
translated: Heat is not a property of things that is impossible for those that are not established as existing by the means of establishment of earth and is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: grang ba yang ma yin pa'i reg bya yang rlung las grub pa'i yod pa nyid las gzhan rnams la srid pa ma yin pa'i dngos po'i chos yin zhing de la yang tshad mas gnod med pa'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: grang ba yang ma yin pa'i reg bya yang rlung las grub pa'i yod pa nyid las gzhan rnams la srid pa ma yin pa'i dngos po'i chos yin zhing de la yang tshad mas gnod med pa'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: The tactile object that is neither hot nor cold is also not possible for anything other than the wind element. It is a phenomenon of a real thing, and it is not undermined by valid cognition.

original: de ltar reg bya yongs su ba'i lhag ma las rlung dang 'brel pa can nyid du grub na /
analyzed: de ltar reg bya yongs su ba'i lhag ma las rlung dang 'brel pa can nyid du grub na /
translated: Thus, the tactile object is established as being connected to the wind element, which is the remainder of the elements.

original: rlung yul gyi khyad par 'am dus kyi bye brag 'ba' zhig tu 'grub pa yin na /
analyzed: rlung yul gyi khyad par 'am dus kyi bye brag 'ba' zhig tu 'grub pa yin na /
translated: If it is established as only a particular object or time of the wind element,üîΩin your system, it is not possible for it to be established as the remainder of those elements.

original: khyod kyi lugs kyi ni de rnams yongs su ba'i lhag ma las grub pa srid pa ma yin no zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyi ni de rnams yongs su ba'i lhag ma las grub pa srid pa ma yin no zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: To explain that, it is said:

original: yod pa nyid ni ma grub ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ma grub ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExistence is not established.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir yod pa nyid ma grub cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa nyid ma grub cing /
translated: Because existence is not established,

original: sa la sogs pa rnams dang dgag pa mtshungs pa yang ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams dang dgag pa mtshungs pa yang ste /
translated: earth and so on are similar to negations.

original: de'i phyir yon tan gyi bye brag med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan gyi bye brag med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, there is no specific quality of the elements.

original: tshul gsum pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos med pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos med pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no phenomenon that possesses the three modes.

original: de'i phyir yon tan gyi bye brag med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan gyi bye brag med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference in the qualities,

original: de la ga las rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ga las rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: how could there be an inference?

original: ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not at all!

original: de ltar re zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnams las dgag pa khas blangs nas rjes su dpag pa med pa brjod cing /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnams las dgag pa khas blangs nas rjes su dpag pa med pa brjod cing /
translated: Thus, having accepted the negation from what is seen and not seen, he states that there is no inference.

original: da ni dgag pa kho na mi rigs so zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dgag pa kho na mi rigs so zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he states the teaching that negation itself is not tenable:

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If non-seeing alone, etc.

original: tsam smos pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang ma mthong ba de kho na las @88a * //
analyzed: tsam smos pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang ma mthong ba de kho na las @88a * //
translated: The addition of ‚Äúalone‚Äù makes it clear that non-seeing of that which is characterized by perception

original: dngos po med pa 'grub po zhes gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'grub po zhes gsal bar byed do //
translated: establishes the non-existence of the thing.

original: 'o na reg bya dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i phyir dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na reg bya dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i phyir dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it reasonable to negate because of the character of the perception of tactility?

original: rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable.

original: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin tsam 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin tsam 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that appearances and their mere nature are refuted.

original: khyod kyis ni sa la sogs pa'i spyi bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyis ni sa la sogs pa'i spyi bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
translated: You, on the other hand, having taken up the generality of earth, etc., speak of a refutation.

original: de la yang shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa rnams la de yod na yang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa rnams la de yod na yang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And in that case, even though it exists in cotton, stone, leaves, etc., a difference in touch is seen.

original: 'ga' zhig tu khyad par yang srid pa las dogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad du ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu khyad par yang srid pa las dogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad du ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And because there is the possibility of a difference in some cases, it is not reasonable to refute by the mere non-seeing in all cases.

original: ma mthong ba rnams las kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: ma mthong ba rnams las kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston ba gsungs pa /
translated: In order to show that it is not reasonable even from the non-seeing, he says:

original: ma mthong ba rnams las ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba rnams las ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Not from the non-seeing, etc.

original: ni'i sgra ni bsdu ba las te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni bsdu ba las te /
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù is from the standpoint of inclusion.

original: nges par 'dzin pa la yang na'o //
analyzed: nges par 'dzin pa la yang na'o //
translated: And ‚Äúalso‚Äù is from the standpoint of restriction.

original: lus can ma yin ba rnams ni thogs ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa /
analyzed: lus can ma yin ba rnams ni thogs ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause non-embodiments are unobstructed‚Äù means

original: thogs pa 'di dgag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: thogs pa 'di dgag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: that this obstruction is refuted.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dngos po'i yang bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dngos po'i yang bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is established as a thing.

original: gal te dgag na ni mngon par bcom pa dang reg pa'i khyad par dag las 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po'am khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dgag na ni mngon par bcom pa dang reg pa'i khyad par dag las 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po'am khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is refuted, then the state of being a cause and effect or the state of being a pervaded and a pervader is not to be expressed in terms of the difference of direct destruction and contact.

original: gang las rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa dag kho na /
analyzed: gang las rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa dag kho na /
translated: Because from the mere reversal of the cause and the pervader,

original: rang dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu dang khyab bya dag ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu dang khyab bya dag ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: the effect and the pervaded that are related to them are also reversed.

original: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po dag kyang mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po dag kyang mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, there would be an extreme fallacy, and the states of being a cause and effect and the states of being a pervaded and a pervader would not be established,

original: mngon bar bcom pa med kyang reg bya'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: mngon bar bcom pa med kyang reg bya'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
translated: because even without direct destruction, there is a difference of contact, and because of being a different object.

original: ci ste lus dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi mngon par bcom pa ma yin ba'i phyir ro zhes pa 'dis mngon par bcom ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba dngos po kho na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste lus dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi mngon par bcom pa ma yin ba'i phyir ro zhes pa 'dis mngon par bcom ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba dngos po kho na brjod par bya ste /
translated: But if you say that it is because the non-associated formative forces are not directly destroyed, then you should say that the non-associated formative forces are a thing,

original: ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis so zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis so zhe na /
translated: because you are using the method of negation.

original: de'i phyir tshe de nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams dang 'brel par bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe de nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams dang 'brel par bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, you must prove that life is related to space, etc.

original: reg pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal ba ste /
translated: And it contradicts the special kind of contact.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ci ltar de dang 'brel pa med cing /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na ci ltar de dang 'brel pa med cing /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be unrelated to and not in contradiction with space, etc.?

original: mi 'gal bas de des der 'gog / ha cang thal ba yang na'o //
analyzed: mi 'gal bas de des der 'gog / ha cang thal ba yang na'o //
translated: The absurd consequence is that it would be impossible to stop it by that.

original: de la re zhig 'brel par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'brel par mi 'grub ste /
translated: First, it is not established that they are related.

original: de ltar ni @88b de rnams la de 'jug pa 'brel par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: de ltar ni @88b de rnams la de 'jug pa 'brel par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: In that case, it would be related to them by engaging with them,

original: yang na des pa skyed par bya ba nyid yin /
analyzed: yang na des pa skyed par bya ba nyid yin /
translated: or it would be produced by them.

original: re zhig 'jug pa 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'jug pa 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not established that it engages with them,

original: de rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are beyond the senses.

original: dbang po las 'das pa rnams la 'ga' zhig gi yang 'jug pa nye bar dmigs pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa rnams la 'ga' zhig gi yang 'jug pa nye bar dmigs pa ma yin pas so //
translated: But it is not perceived to enter into any of the supersensible objects.

original: nye bar dmigs pa med pa yang 'di 'dir 'jug go zhes nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa med pa yang 'di 'dir 'jug go zhes nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not possible to ascertain that the non-apprehension of something is its non-existence.

original: des bskyed par bya ba nyid kyang 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba nyid kyang 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the production of it established,

original: ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the negative concomitance is not established.

original: rjes su 'gro ba tsam las rgyu'i nus pa rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba tsam las rgyu'i nus pa rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The causal capacity is not understood from the mere positive concomitance,

original: 'on kyang ldog pa las kyang ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ldog pa las kyang ste /
translated: but also from the negative concomitance.
